content: @WG-learning remember that in around 3hs we have the sync
maybe this meeting will be a bit more than a sync
I've built a tentative agenda which includes a LOT of things to discuss for a 30 minutes meeting
feel free to add stuff, change stuff, whatever
I've prioritized the topics, so if we don't have time we won't be able to reach to the end but that's fine
Added blog post topic but that will probably require input from Niko as well

I won't be able to attend tonight, as of a work event. As an update: right now I'm still digging into rustc but I also started working on a "A first glance at rustc" document...will share as soin as it is in a useful state

It's actually related to tbe work through thing. I want to somehiw cover the whole comoilation process of a simple example (fibonacci for now) and shiw and discuss various intermediary artifacts. But it also shall give an overview of rustc
Last question: is today the fixed time for the meeting, like weekly, as it's not yet in the calendar? Or mine is just not updated...

Last question: is today the fixed time for the meeting, like weekly, as it's not yet in the calendar? Or mine is just not updated...

It is in fact in the calendar, I see it set as every two weeks
Anyways, if necessary we could meet later or tomorrow or I'll just check the notes and reply accordingly!
If this time is inconvenient we can ask @Santiago Pastorino to open a new vote and we'll see about moving it.
Nah, then it's just me who did not get the info yet - thanks!
And now it's there :+1:

I will most likely be in the meeting today unless something comes up at work.

For now I am still working through https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-guide/pull/316. Going to track down answers to some of the questions and a couple of sections I need to write like introduction.
I added an item to discuss the remaining parts of the book that have not been written about
I guess it would be important to try to focus on a couple of topics only, this seems to be too much :)
@mark-i-m I think the stuff your pointing to is probably one of the most important ones
with the walkthrough section
agree... it can be a rolling agenda
we can move things to next meeting as needed, I think
yes
I've moved your item to the top
actually, I've sorted the list again based on what I think are the priorities
please check that out because I may be wrong :)
I added a list of missing chapters/parts of chapters
Feel free to update/edit
great
